page.title: 10A LOCAL CUSTOM
page.content: EVERY YEAR WE HAVE A{CARNIVAL}IN BIDEFORD. DIFFERENT CLUBS GET TOGETHER AND{ORGANISE}A{THEME}FOR THE FLOAT. THEN ON THE DAY OF THE{CARNIVAL}PEOPLE GATHER IN A CERTAIN PLACE TO DRESS THE {FLOAT.}LATER THEY GO TO THE START WHERE THEY ARE{JUDGED.}ONCE JUDGING HAS TAKEN PLACE THE{PROCESSION}BEGINS AND GOES THROUGH THE TOWN WHERE THERE ARE LOTS OF PEOPLE WHO{THROW MONEY ON THE FLOATS AND INTO BUCKETS. ALL THIS MONEY GOES TO LOCAL{CHARITIES. {THIS YEAR}THEY WANT TO BUY AN{E.C.G {MACHINE}FOR THE{LOCAL HOSPITAL. IN 1985 THE CARNIVAL{STARTED}AT MORETON PARK ROAD, AND{FINSHED}AT NORTH ROAD. THE THREE BIDEFORD{WITCHES}WERE TEMPERANCE LLOYD MARY TREMBLES AND SUSANNAH EDWARDS. THEIR TRIAL WAS HELD ON 14TH AUGUST 1682 AND WERE HANGED ON 25 AUGUST 1682.
